subject: Technology
title: What Is the World Wide Web
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on What Is the World Wide Web.

hook.text: People say 'the web' and 'the internet' mean the same thing. They are not even close.

buildup.text: The internet is the physical network of cables and routers. It existed twenty years before the web.

discovery.text: The web is a layer on top, invented by Tim Berners-Lee in 1989. It uses hyperlinks to connect pages.

twist.text: Berners-Lee could have patented it and become incredibly rich. He gave it away for free.

climax.text: That decision let anyone create a website. The web exploded from one page to over a billion.

punchline.text: The web is what you see. The internet is how it gets there.

quiz.question: What is the difference between the internet and the web?
options: The internet is the network; the web is a layer of linked pages on top
The web is hardware; the internet is software
